t: Three years after Amazon arrived, this Tijuana neighborhood remains one of the city's poorest | KPBS Public Media
s: November 18, 2024 - In 2021, an Amazon fulfillment center brought hope to Nueva Esperanza. But today the community continues to lack basic services like paved roads, drinkable water and a stormwater system.

t: Some Tijuana locals say they're hopeful about a new Amazon warehouse that social media users called dystopian
s: October 10, 2021 - Photographer Omar Martinez captured photos of the Amazon facility, the first of its kind in Tijuana, that showed the brand-new facility standing feet away from a sprawling community of makeshift homes made of wood, tarps, and cardboard, where stray dogs lie in unpaved streets.

t: New Amazon facility in Tijuana opens amid praise and controversy - Los Angeles Times
s: September 15, 2021 - Unpaved roads lead to homes that are built with wood scraps and have tarps as roofing in Tijuana’s Nueva Esperanza neighborhood. ... Amazon is scheduled to start operations in what will be its eleventh distribution center in Mexico on Sept. 22, said Arlene Herrera, spokeswoman for Amazon Mexico.

t: Amazon was supposed to transform a Tijuana slum. It failed to deliver - Rest of World
s: April 4, 2024 - Amazon benefits from local poverty through exploitative subcontracts, experts say.

t: Photos of a new, sprawling Amazon warehouse in Mexico surrounded by deteriorating shacks have gone viral as the tech giant continues to expand its footprint internationally
s: September 7, 2021 - Amazon said its new Tijuana warehouse would create 250 jobs. It's part of a $100 million investment in Mexico to improve delivery speeds.

t: We Visited the Impoverished Homes Outside Amazon's Tijuana, Mexico Warehouse - Business Insider
s: October 23, 2021 - Amazon's new facility stands next to an impoverished neighborhood. Some locals said they want jobs with the company, while others fear being evicted.

t: Amazon to Open $21 Million State-of-the-Art Warehouse in Tijuana Slum
s: August 9, 2024 - Amazon will open a $21 million state-of-the-art warehouse in Tijuana, Mexico, that abuts a housing settlement made of cardboard, tarp, and wood scraps.

t: Amazon en Tijuana: la polémica por las fotos de un gigantesco almacén de la empresa construido en medio de un barrio marginal en México - BBC News Mundo
s: September 8, 2021 - Las fotos tomadas cerca de la frontera entre México y Estados Unidos se viralizaron en pocas horas en las redes sociales. ¿Qué hay detrás de estas imágenes que las hace tan controvertidas?
